knimeNode.name: Dictionary Extractor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a global dictionary over all documents.

fullDescription.intro:
This node creates a global dictionary over all documents. Additionally, it creates three frequency columns: Term frequency, document frequency and inverse document frequency. The term frequency is the count of a term in all documents. The document frequency specifies the number of documents in which a term occurs.
The inverse document frequency is used to measure how much information a term provides. To calculate the frequency, the total number of all documents is divided by the number of documents in which the term occurs. Afterwards the fraction is logarithmically scaled:
idf(t) = log(f(D) / f(d,t))
More information about term frequencies can be found here.
It is possible to create a data table containing only the most frequent terms based on the selected frequency count. The node also provides an index column with numbers which can be used for replacing words with numbers while preprocessing documents for deep learning.
fullDescription.option: Select the document column to extract the document from.
Check, if the data table should be restricted on the top k most frequent terms.
If the 'Most frequent terms (k)' option is checked, the terms are sorted by the selected frequency method (TF, DF or IDF). Only the top-k most frequent terms are then added to the data table.
The number of threads used to process the documents.

ports.inPort: The input table containing the documents.
ports.outPort: An output table containing a dictionary column, frequency columns and an index column.
